8-1 win for Real Madrid against Barcelona in the UEFA Ideal Team

Not unsurprisingly, Real Madrid have monopolised UEFA's Ideal Team in the Champions League.

Of the 18 members, eight are from Los Blancos and only one from Barcelona; Leo Messi.

Keylor Navas, Sergio Ramos, Raphael Varane, Marcelo, Casemiro, Toni Kroos, Luka Modric and Cristiano Ronaldo have all been selected by UEFA.

The lineup is completed by Alisson (Roma), Kimmich (Bayern), Chiellini (Juventus), Van Dijk (Liverpool), De Bruyne (Manchester City), James (Bayern), Dzeko (Rome), Firmino (Liverpool) , Messi (Barcelona) and Salah).

Gareth Bale wants Manchester United transfer after Champions League final goals but wages a stumbling block

Gareth Bale‘s first choice of club remains Manchester United by some distance, if the Champions League match-winner were to leave Real Madrid this summer – although there is now much more doubt over whether the Premier League side would do a deal.

replies.msg:
Bale is interested in a move to Bayern Munich but the Bundesliga champions will have to break their transfer structure to fund a move for the Wales winger. Bayern and Manchester United are the leading candidates to sign the unsettled attacker from Madrid but he's expected to cost around €100m (£87m).

Bayern president Uli Hoeness ruled out making large investments on transfers this summer with CEO Karl-Heinz Rummenigge placing a €100m (£87m) limit on spending. (Sport Bild)
